sentences: Herbert Joos ([ˈhɛʁbɛʁt ˈjoːs]; 21 March 1940 – 7 December 2019) was a German jazz trumpeter, flugelhornist, and graphic designer.
Born in Karlsruhe, Joos learned trumpet first by self-study and then by a private teacher.
He studied double bass from 1958, but then turned to flugelhorn, baritone horn, mellophone, and alphorn.

He played at festivals and in the Free Jazz Meeting Baden-Baden of the SWF at a flugelhorn workshop with Kenny Wheeler, Ian Carr, Harry Beckett and Ack van Rooyen and made a name for himself with his solo recording, The Philosophy of the Flugelhorn in 1973.
He achieved more recognition in the 1980s as a member of the Vienna Art Orchestra, which he influenced.
Since the 1990s he has participated in the SüdPool project.
In 2017, he was awarded the Jazzpreis Baden-Württemberg for his life's work.
Herbert Joos died on 7 December 2019 after surgery in a Baden-Baden hospital.
Cracked Mirrors / Harry Pepl, Herbert Joos, Jon Christensen (1988)
Orchestra / Eberhard Weber (1989)With Vienna Art Orchestra
